marketNews.title: US-China Trade Agreement Framework Reached
marketNews.content:
The US and China governments on Tuesday (June 10) announced that the two countries have agreed on a framework for a trade agreement. The new framework, which resulted from negotiations in London, United Kingdom since the beginning of this week, will still be reviewed by the respective presidents of both countries.

US Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick said the framework will include acceleration of rare earth metal and magnet exports from China for the US automotive and defense industries. Meanwhile, the US will relax exports of several of its commodities to China, although Lutnick did not provide further details.

The framework agreed in London is a continuation of the US-China negotiations to de-escalate trade tensions. Previously, the US and China had reached a temporary agreement last month in Geneva, Switzerland, which included a reduction of import tariffs by each side by 115 percentage points for 90 days.

Trade tensions between the US and China have put pressure on the Chinese economy. This is reflected in the contraction of the China Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) to 48.3 in May 2025 – the lowest level since September 2022 – and an annual deflation of –0.1% year-on-year for four consecutive months.

Key Takeaway: The continued discussion and achievement of the trade-agreement framework between the US and China shows a commitment to easing trade tensions. However, the lack of details in the announced framework and the need for each president’s approval leave uncertainty. Consequently, market reactions were muted on Wednesday (June 5) with S&P 500 futures down 0.28%, SSE up 0.52%, EuroStoxx 50 down 0.22%, and the US dollar index (DXY) flat up 0.03%.

marketNews.title: Other hot news you need to know
marketNews.content:
1. The World Bank’s latest June 2025 outlook cuts Indonesia’s economic growth projection to 4.7% year-on-year for 2025 and 4.8% for 2026, each 0.4 and 0.3 percentage points lower than the January 2025 outlook. The World Bank also lowers the global growth projection to 2.3% for 2025 and 2.4% for 2026, also 0.4 and 0.3 percentage points lower than the January outlook. The downgrade is driven by rising trade tensions and global policy uncertainty.

2. Bloomberg reports that US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has become one of the candidates proposed by President Donald Trump’s advisers to head the Federal Reserve. White House officials denied the rumor without further comment. Previously, Trump said he would soon announce the Fed chief who will replace Jerome Powell after his term ends in May 2026. Earlier, former Fed governor Kevin Warsh was reported as Trump’s favorite candidate.

3. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded domestic motorcycle sales of 505,350 units in May 2025, a decline of 0.1% year-on-year but an increase of 24% month-on-month. The 5-month-to-date sales reached approximately 2.59 million units, down 2.4% year-on-year, representing 39-41% of the 2025 target of 6.4-6.7 million units (2024 5-month-to-date realization was 42%).

marketNews.title: Investment Strategy from the IHSG Ocean Ecosystem
marketNews.content: "Don't become a small fish eaten by sharks (market makers)! Always do your research before investing." – SintaPutri4

tickerNews.title: BTPS plans share buyback of up to 927 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah plans a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 927 billion rupiah between 11 June and 9 September 2025, although the company did not disclose the number of shares to be repurchased. The corporate action does not require a shareholders’ meeting, following the relaxation granted by OJK to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: BBNI to issue sustainability bond up to 5 trillion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia plans to issue a sustainability bond of up to 5 trillion rupiah, with proceeds intended for financing environmentally and socially oriented business activities. The bond will be issued in two series with tenors of three and five years, although the interest rate has not been announced. The public offering, which has received an idAAA rating from Pefindo, is scheduled for 2-3 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTPP records new contract value of 7.65 trillion rupiah in May 2025
tickerNews.content: The corporate secretary of PT PP, Joko Raharjo, told Kontan that the company recorded a new contract value of 7.65 trillion rupiah during the 5-month-to-May 2025 period, a 14% year-on-year decline, representing 26.9% of the 2025 target. The revenue was dominated by projects from state-owned enterprises (44%), followed by private sector (36%) and government (20%).

tickerNews.title: SILO decides not to distribute 2024 dividend and allocates 2 trillion rupiah capex for 2025
tickerNews.content: Siloam International Hospitals’ shareholders’ meeting on Wednesday (11 June) decided not to distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024. Director Daniel Phua said the decision is a way for the company to manage its cash to support business growth. SILO allocated a capital expenditure of 2 trillion rupiah for 2025 (versus 1.4-2 trillion rupiah in 2024), which will be used to introduce robotic health facilities and increase the number of operational hospital beds.

tickerNews.title: NICL share purchase by Christopher Sumasto Tjia of 4 million shares
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of PAM Mineral, Christopher Sumasto Tjia, bought 4 million shares of NICL at an average price of 1,042 rupiah per share on 10 June 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.2 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Christopher Sumasto Tjia’s direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.271% to 0.308%.

tickerNews.title: MYOR targets 39.7 trillion rupiah sales and 3.1 trillion rupiah profit in 2025, announces dividend
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah’s director Hendrik Polisar said the company targets sales of 39.7 trillion rupiah and net profit of 3.1 trillion rupiah for 2025, indicating growth of +10% year-on-year in sales and +3.3% year-on-year in profit. To achieve the target, the company will raise product selling prices in response to raw material cost increases, continue product innovation, and optimise marketing and promotion activities. MYOR will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 1.2 trillion rupiah or 55 rupiah per share, corresponding to a 40% dividend payout ratio (2023: ~39%) and a dividend yield of 2.5% as of Wednesday (11 June). The cum-date has not been announced, while payment is scheduled for 10 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: GIAA evaluates Garuda Indonesia’s request for additional funding for aircraft procurement
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported on Wednesday (11 June) that BPI CEO Rosan Roeslani said the company is evaluating Garuda Indonesia’s request for additional funding for the procurement of 15 aircraft. Kontan did not detail the aircraft, but Bloomberg reported last week that GIAA is in talks with Danantara regarding a potential capital injection of 500 million US dollars, intended to restore operations of more than a dozen Citilink aircraft.

tickerNews.title: BFIN plans bond issuance up to 1 trillion rupiah
tickerNews.content: BFI Finance Indonesia plans to issue bonds up to 1 trillion rupiah, with proceeds intended for financing investments as well as working capital and multi-purpose needs. The bonds will be issued in three series with tenors of 370 days (interest 6.45%), 2 years (interest 6.8%) and 3 years (interest 6.9%). The public offering, which has received an idAA- rating from Pefindo, is scheduled for 11-12 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: FAST signs credit facility up to 875 billion rupiah with Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Fast Food Indonesia signs a credit facility of up to 875 billion rupiah from Bank Mandiri. The loan consists of: 1) investment refinancing credit up to 200 billion rupiah with a ten-year term; 2) term loan of 525 billion rupiah with an eight-year term; and 3) working-capital credit of 150 billion rupiah with a one-year term.

tickerNews.title: RSGK commissioner buys 21.8 million shares at 1,179 rupiah
tickerNews.content: Komisaris Kedoya Adyaraya (RSGK), Hungkang Sutedja, bought 21.8 million shares of RSGK at a price of 1,179 rupiah per share on 27 May 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 25.7 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Hungkang Sutedja’s ownership in RSGK increased from zero to 2.34%.
